name: Google - Simple background image code
description: I am trying to remain the most current Google style available! I've figured out how to make it more friendly toward the use of dark images, so feel free to use whatever you like. If you still want to check out the other style that came before this, click here. "Simple" may as well be an overstatement with how complicated the Google pages have become lately. This style was created to address the issue of Google removing background images for all users. claiming incapability with their new software; Well, we know nothing is impossible with a little extra code, and this, like everything else on userstyles.org stands as a testament to that. Find any image, then apply the image in the code, replacing the included stock image URL. Have fun with this style, and tweak it to your preferences. Problems? E-Mail me at bluufoxx.at.gmail/dot/com. Do this to ensure I don't take another eon to revise this style!
additional_info:
I will keep on updating this style, so always back up or re-save as your own style if you don't want to keep up with changes. Otherwise, the ride's still rough and it'll still be some time before the dust settles. I created a new style for those looking to modify the top bar in search results! Check it out here. Fixed! This actually means something now! I also made a new style for the Google Grid menu people can have fun customizing. Find it here. While not necessarily for those looking to use dark background images, you can use this to make your Google+ name white, and not have it interfere with readability elsewhere. Thanks for the support people! I made this style free-of-charge for study and reuse. If you want more people to know about this, then feel free to bring this to the attention of your local media! I am sure tech blogs are itching to create an article on how to re-introduce Google background images, and this is it! Be sure to spread the word; Can we get this to 5,000 installations? If you know a web admin doesn't want hotlinking or any other bullcrap like that, don't use their image directly; Save it, then use from local filesystem or encode it in base64. Additional features of this style: * Styles the footer bar to match the header bar * Removes the Google logo (because I don't know how to replace it, and it looks cleaner) See update 2 * Adds padding to fill out the bottom See update 8 * Adds color-matched border at the header and footer, for that awesome pinstripe look. This means nothing anymore, but you can kind of get that back with the dark header style linked further up. Update 1: * Adds text color property for text below the seatch bar (hopefully for both images and search) * Colors links below the search bar * Adds text shadow property to make the Google account username better stand out in dark backgrounds. Update 2: * Lifts restriction on Google logo, because of another style I found that addresses this issue. See here. Update 3: Maintenance fix, added new ID for Google Search/Images Update 4: Fixed image displaying in search results by swapping ID #gsr for class .hp Update 5: Thanks Sonny for the regexp string! I was having a hard time figuring that out. Updating this style because Google Drive / Docs uses class gb on the very top. Wanted to fix that so Google Docs didn't show the background image there. left the old code in for people who want to reverse the change. Update 6: Added Google Images and Google Play to the list, forgot to fix that. Basically, re-introducing some old behaviors for people who want that. And more code comments. Update 7: Impulse update to replace the URL -- Luckily I had it on my computer as my desktop wallpaper! Update 8: Maintenance fix, I somehow missed that Google changed their site code AGAIN, so I decided to update the code to accommodate these changes. Hopefully I broke nothing. #footer is now .fbar and the padding is removed. Also, found the source image on DeviantArt! This style was made on a 1600*900 screen, so if there are issues on smaller (or larger) resolutions, do leave a comment. I made sure the inline code comments holds the hands of newbies. If you enjoy this and want it everywhere, look into using a portable copy of Firefox with Stylish Sync. Update 9: Image location reverted as it was in update 7. Sorry for the fails! Image Galactic Fractal created by Nathen Smith. Available via DeviantArt! Update 10: Caught the new rollout early! Also, any code to become useless in the future has [L] in the comments to express legacy code. Everything should still work for people who did not get the new rollout yet. Update 11: Modified some comments to be more user-friendly for newbs, and found the white icons in Google's default image set, therefore making the style 100% dark background friendly.
Update 12: The "F*** it, ship it" update. This is the last update log I will place here, see the code for more information. Basically, more comments, code for Google international, and a bigger, badder regexp string that is dedicated to affecting only the Google Images and Google Search front pages. Edit: Since update 13, I discovered that the regexp string doesn't apply when clicking on the Google link in the header. Sorry!
